definition: warm/agreeable
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs

sentences.english: You can't junction without GF, no matter how high your level.
sentences.chinese: 不管級別多高，沒有GF就不可以融和。

sentences.english: The real question is, will it blend?
sentences.chinese: 真正的問題是，它會融和嗎？

sentences.english: Banbo not be very kind to dust Zi, extremely Chan Yan and get its own integration.
sentences.chinese: 要極其斑剝而不類於塵滓，極其巉巖而自得其融和。

sentences.english: In the U. S. a constant flow of immigrants is being amalgamated .
sentences.chinese: 在美國，移民正不斷的興之融和。

sentences.english: Let all the strains of joy mingle in my last song.
sentences.chinese: 讓一切歡樂的歌調都融和在我最後的歌中。

sentences.english: Brahmanism and Mahayana have passed a long process of mixture and interfusion.
sentences.chinese: 婆羅門教與大乘佛教經過了長期融和的過程。

sentences.english: In fact, the real walking, should be a natural harmony with distractions.
sentences.chinese: 其實，真正的散步，應該是心無旁騖的與自然地融和。

definition: old variant of 融[rong2]
to blend/to integrate/to amalgamate/to fuse
fusion/to combine as one
to blend/to mix
a mixture/an amalgam/fusion/welding together/to be in harmony with (nature)/to harmonize with/to fit in
mix together/put together (usu. things that do not blend well together)
to form a cohesive whole/to fuse together
to circulate/to flow (esp. capital)/to intermingle/to merge/to become assimilated
to merge together (idiom); to unify disparate elements into one whole
to blend
compatible/consistent/to tolerate (each other)
to fuse together (idiom)/hypostatic union (religion)
to knead (clay)
to make no distinction between what's one's own and what's another's (idiom)/to share everything/to be on very intimate terms
a blend/a mix
to complement one another (idiom)
